content.description: A varied line with crack climbing, face, an overhang and a puzzling crux. Start in small narrow gully and climb finger crack. Crack ends--zig left then right to stance under overhang. Bust a crimpy, tricky crux move on golden-white rock (bolt). Catch a kind-of rest and gear (TCU/finger size), then pull a final 5.11 move (bolt) to top anchors.
content.protection: Normal TN trad rack. Mixed, 2 bolts. Anchors.
content.location: Right side of wall, where gully narrows.

content.description: An excellent trad line with a huge variety of styles and features--a hand-crack roof, a corner, knobby face climbing and a finishing ride on the edge of an arete. Crank and jam through initial overhangs. Grapple over a pillar then enjoy a clean dihedral. Escape right around little overhang, then move back left up a great face. Finish just right of arete to anchors at lip. Finishes with nice views high over Soddy Gorge and up Deep Creek.
content.protection: Normal Sunset or T Wall rack up to #3. Doubles up to #2 will provide full coverage. Take some long slings to extend gear.
content.location: Start among washing machine sized blocks, under short roof, split by a hand crack, about 15' up; above that you should see a white corner. A big chestnut oak might obscure the rest of the view. This is just climber's right of where the wall makes a 90 degree turn up hill to the hidden meadow--the 'lorax hole'. And this is climbers'-left of Departure 29 roofs, which are about 50' climbers'-right.

climbs.name: Departure 29
climbs.fa: J. Dorough, C. Fowler, C. Wykle

content.description: Begin under shade of imposing roof ~30' up. Roughly follow steep corner to base of big flat roof; rail out and over, exiting out vertical crack (great protection here, just manage for drag carefully with long slings). Chase crack to narrow ledge. Move a good bit right to beautiful tan-orange left-facing corner that points to the sky. Climb this until it peters out, hang in there for techy face final round, then pull over top ledge for a Soddy-summit experience. Two bolt anchor.
content.location: About 100' above the Cumberland Trail. The tan and orange upper face and mini-corner will grab your eye. But the first quarter or so is steep with a flat 15' roof about thirty feet up. It is about 75' climbers' right of Gift From Nature 5.8.

content.description: Awesome crack to great, sculpted holds and horizontals in white and orange rock. Head to anchors under little cap stone overhanging top.
content.protection: Normal TN trad rack, maybe on lighter side.
content.location: Left side of wall. Locate obvious crack that starts up face.

content.description: Left-most route in this hidden spot. Climb up flakes to tricky crux move on great rock. Clip bolt and chug a few horizontals to anchors. Worth it if you did the better on to the right.
content.location: Left most on this wall, just right of vegetation gully-corner. Climber's left of Born Slippy.

content.description: A wonderful section with great rock, a hidden trove of quality routes tucked up in a "lorax hole", and the classic, early Soddy original 'Departure 29'.  The "lorax hole" is kind of a hidden gully up to the left, with a hidden south facing wall. This wall wraps around north and east for a few more great trad routes. All in all a really nice collection of routes from 5.8-5.12.
